row.inscription: Written in black ink on handle: Kaigo.
row.description: 1 kote (mon making tool) : wood, iron ; 11.5 x 0.875 (diameter) in. Kote (mon making tool) composed of a heavy iron cylinder (0.875 in. diameter) attached to metal rod with wooden handle with five grooves on end. Flat surface of cylinder on end.
row.title: Kote

row.inscription: Written in black ink felt pen on bottom: B. Kawakami.
row.description: 1 pair of geta with black velvet straps : wood, velvet ; each 9.25 x 4.25 x 2.125 in. Japanese style wooden slippers composed of a baseboard (dai) resting on two supporting pieces (ha or teeth) with a black velvet strap that is secured at the front middle of the baseboard by a decorative metal piece (flower shaped) on underside covering hole for toe strap, and at the sides of the foot. The geta are identical in shape: right (A) and left (B) side. Edges are rounded.
row.title: Geta with black velvet straps

row.inscription: Signed in medium, bottom left corner: H. Sugimoto, 84Written on back: [Japanese characters on upper left corner]
row.description: Stretched and framed, marker on canvas. Split imagery of life in coal mine and world above. One man shovels coal, right foreground, while another raises a pickaxe above coal in wall on left. Behind them one man pushes a coal bin on tracks, right midground, as a man walks with a pickaxe and bucket in tunnel. All men are dressed in brown pants, black boots, cap and blue vest over tan shirt. A lamp shines light from above. At top, cloud-like image of trees and coal mill with sign, \"Coal Mine,\" under sunny sky.
row.title: Untitled (Coal Miners)
row.credit: Gift of Madeleine Sugimoto and Naomi Tagawa, Japanese American National Museum
row.dimensions: L: 64 in, W: 51.5 in, D: 1 in
